Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece. Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Stand the cake in a few inches of scalding hot water until the pan feels warm (a roasting pan works well for this). Drape the cake in plastic wrap to protect its surface, then invert onto a large, flat plate, and lift the pan to pull it away.
